supporting_text: The strategy represents a roadmap for efforts to tackle antibiotic resistance... based on a broad, cross-sectoral One Health perspective, involving multiple areas such as human and animal health, the environment, research, education, trade and international development cooperation.

The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including... effective measures are taken to prevent infections and infection transmission and to minimise the spread of multi-resistant bacteria.
The NAP includes actions such as... the need for antibiotics in animals is reduced through efficient disease control, good farm management, biosecurity and sound animal husbandry.
The NAP states... emissions of antibiotics and antimicrobial substances to the environment are minimised.
The NAP emphasizes... safe international trade in both living animals and animal products is particularly important.
The Government expects... activities regarding antibiotic resistance are followed up and the lessons learnt are acted upon.
The national '250 target' in primary care (fewer than 250 antibiotic prescriptions issued per 1,000 inhabitants per year) was introduced in 2009.
The NAP includes... the number of antibiotic prescriptions filled annually fell by around one million between 2009 and 2017.
The document does not specify any budget allocation for the strategies or actions.
The document does not contain an assessment of future budget requirements.
A national collaborative function currently comprising 25 government agencies and other organisations coordinates national efforts against antibiotic resistance since 2012.
The NAP includes... the Swedish Board of Agriculture regulations govern the use in animals of drugs that are particularly important for the treatment of humans.
The NAP expects... antibiotic resistance, infection prevention and control and healthcare hygiene to be included in relevant basic education and professional training.
The NAP emphasizes... it is important that the information is coordinated in each sector and between the sectors, so that the general public receive the same message.
The NAP states... Sweden to continue to support WHO, FAO, OIE and UNEP in efforts to tackle AMR.
The NAP includes... access to data on antibiotic resistance and the sale and use of antibiotics and other antimicrobial agents in all sectors, as well as data on healthcare-associated infections.
The NAP emphasizes... the ability to systematically monitor the long-term trends regarding infections in humans and animals, the resistance situation and sale and use of antibiotics.
The NAP states... infection prevention and control measures and practices are fundamental in curbing infections and spread of infection in health and social care and in veterinary care.
The NAP emphasizes... Sweden to urge the EU to pursue issues relevant to AMR at the global level.
The NAP includes... the Swedish Board of Agriculture regulations govern the use in animals of drugs that are particularly important for the treatment of humans.
The NAP states... antibiotics to continue only to be used after being prescribed by professionals who are authorised to prescribe antibiotics.
The NAP expects... Sweden to take part in international research cooperation in the field of antibiotic resistance and related areas.
